definition: to rise to power (in politics)/to go on stage (in the theater)
on top/upon/above/upper/previous/first (of multiple parts)/to climb/to get onto/to go up/to attend (class or university)

sentences.english: He put the crouch-back♠ onstage, and sold tickets.
sentences.chinese: 他把这个驼背怪物搬上台，卖票给人看。

sentences.english: In fact, there was no revisionism in China.
sentences.chinese: 实际上中国并没有修正主义上台。

sentences.english: She walked on stage again, shaking from head to foot, and started speaking.
sentences.chinese: 她再次走上台，浑身上下抖个不停，开始说台词。

sentences.english: Do you knohen the first Chinese empress came to power?
sentences.chinese: 你知道中国第一位女皇帝是什么时候上台执政的吗？

sentences.english: This girl then walked on stage and she hadn't a stitch on.
sentences.chinese: 然后这个女孩子走上台去，而她还光着身子。

sentences.english: I'm ready to be on the stage.
Some of them are here this evening, and a few will even join us onstage.
sentences.chinese: 他们有些今晚也在场，有几位更会上台与大家见面。

sentences.english: After the Austria Pama comes on stage, has made the obvious adjustment to the anti-terrorist policy.
sentences.chinese: 奥巴马上台后对反恐政策做出了明显调整。

sentences.english: Four years ago in a mid-sized Shandong town, a new mayor came to power.
sentences.chinese: 四年前，山东的一个中型城市，新市长上台。
爷爷上台，把小女孩摇醒。

sentences.english: When we came to power, a part of the country was under the LTTE jackboot .
sentences.chinese: 当我们上台后，部分国家的猛虎组织掌。

sentences.english: The prime minister of japan changed again this week.
sentences.chinese: 本周日本首相再度易人，鸠山下台，菅直人上台。

sentences.english: Then the emcee asked Lin Yingying to sing evening primrose.
sentences.chinese: 接着主持人上台请林婴婴演唱《夜来香》。

sentences.english: Red fruits and BaiYu also took to help special Sally.
sentences.chinese: 红果和白雨也上台来帮特殊突围。

sentences.english: War-weariness has not brought a pro-Moscow regime to power.
sentences.chinese: 厌战情绪还没有带来一个亲莫斯科政权上台。

sentences.english: I am willing to share the summary of the advance class with others.
sentences.chinese: 本人愿意在高级班上课时上台和学员分享本篇心得。

definition: to go off the stage/to fall from position of prestige/to step down (from office etc)/to disentangle oneself/to get off the hook
to make a speech/to make some remarks
announce the items on a (theatrical) program
to take part in an election/to run for office
Barack Obama (1961-), US Democrat politician, president 2009-2017
Sichuanese pidgin (the mix of Standard Mandarin and Sichuanese dialect)/(Tw) surname Trump
to continue in (a political) office/to serve for another term of office
Donald Trump (1946-), American business magnate, US president 2017-
